# Copilot Instructions for nextstop

This repository is in its early stages of development. Please follow these guidelines when contributing:

## Code Standards

### General Principles
- Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code
- Follow best practices for the programming language(s) being used
- Ensure all code changes include appropriate tests where applicable
- Keep commits focused and atomic

### Development Flow
- Before making changes, understand the existing codebase structure
- Run all tests before committing changes
- Ensure code is properly formatted according to project standards
- Update documentation when making functional changes

## Repository Structure
- `.github/`: GitHub-specific configuration and workflows
- `README.md`: Project overview and documentation

## Key Guidelines
1. Maintain consistency with existing code style and patterns
2. Add tests for new functionality when test infrastructure exists
3. Document public APIs and complex logic
4. Keep dependencies minimal and up-to-date
5. Follow semantic versioning for releases when applicable

## Testing
- Write unit tests for new features and bug fixes
- Ensure tests are maintainable and clearly describe what they're testing
- Run the full test suite before submitting changes

## Documentation
- Update README.md when adding new features or changing behavior
- Include inline comments for complex logic
- Document any setup or configuration requirements
